text:
Summary by Ground News A series of armed attacks that started over the weekend in the central Nigerian state of Plateau has resulted in the death of 178 people. Nigerian Vice President Kashim Shettima visited the area on Wednesday to express solidarity with the grieving families. Amnesty International indicated on Tuesday in a statement that the attacks had left more than 140 dead. Share menu More
